data.question: What is the synthesis temperature for X-pcu-5-Zn-α?
What solvent is used in the synthesis of X-pcu-5-Zn-α?
What is the CO2 uptake capacity of X-pcu-5-Zn-α at 195 K?
How is X-pcu-5-Zn-β obtained from X-pcu-5-Zn-α?
data.answer: By activation of the CO2 loaded X-pcu-5-Zn-α form

data.question: What is the structural difference between X-pcu-5-Zn-α and X-pcu-5-Zn-γ in terms of coordination geometry?
data.answer: X-pcu-5-Zn-α and X-pcu-5-Zn-β are based upon 'paddlewheel' clusters, while X-pcu-5-Zn-γ has a different coordination geometry

data.question: What triggers the reversible switching between nonporous and porous phases in X-pcu-5-Zn?
Is the transformation between X-pcu-5-Zn-α and its polymorphs a single-crystal-to-single-crystal process?
What is the gate-opening pressure for CO2 sorption in X-pcu-5-Zn-β?
Does X-pcu-5-Zn-γ exhibit a Type F-IV isotherm for CO2 sorption at 195 K?
What is the effect of high-pressure CO2 sorption on X-pcu-5-Zn-γ at 268 K?
Can X-pcu-5-Zn-β revert to X-pcu-5-Zn-α upon exposure to DMF?
What is the role of methanol in the synthesis process of X-pcu-5-Zn polymorphs?
data.answer: Methanol exchange is used to transform X-pcu-5-Zn-α to X-pcu-5-Zn-β

data.question: Is the transformation from X-pcu-5-Zn-α to X-pcu-5-Zn-β reversible?
data.answer: Yes, the transformation is reversible when soaked in DMF

data.question: What is the effect of heating X-pcu-5-Zn-β?
data.answer: Heating X-pcu-5-Zn-β results in the formation of X-pcu-5-Zn-γ

data.question: How does the structural transformation affect the gas sorption properties of X-pcu-5-Zn?
data.answer: The structural transformation enables reversible switching between nonporous and porous phases, affecting CO2 uptake

data.question: Is the CO2 uptake capacity of X-pcu-5-Zn-γ higher than 250 cm3/g at 195 K?
What is the significance of the paddlewheel clusters in X-pcu-5-Zn-α and X-pcu-5-Zn-β?
data.answer: Paddlewheel clusters are structural motifs that contribute to the framework's stability and sorption properties

data.question: Does X-pcu-5-Zn-γ revert to X-pcu-5-Zn-α when soaked in DMF at room temperature?
What is the role of high-pressure CO2 sorption in the phase transformation of X-pcu-5-Zn-γ?
data.answer: High-pressure CO2 sorption at 268 K triggers the phase transformation of X-pcu-5-Zn-γ

data.question: Can the phase transformation of X-pcu-5-Zn polymorphs be controlled by solvent and temperature?
data.answer: Yes, the phase transformation can be controlled by solvent exchange and temperature adjustments
